name: Black Magic Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Let's start with the word "Black"

Add on the end the letter that appears in all of these three words.

Every, Dove, Aviation
questions.explanation:
Blackv.

	The letter "v" is the only similarity.

questions.text:
Take the above word and add on the letter that is common between these words:

Bagel, Gram, Bug
questions.explanation:
Blackvg.

	The letter g appears in all three words, while b and a appear in 2 out of 3.

questions.text:
One more time.

Add the letter that appears in these three words:

Double, Bread, Mad
questions.explanation:
Blackvgd.

	Both the letters a and b appear in two words. While d is the correct answer.

questions.text:
Now, different instructions. 

Eliminate the fourth letter.
questions.explanation:
Blakvgd.

	The c in black is the word to take out.

questions.text: Now eliminate the letter that is the only vowel in the line
questions.explanation:
Blkvgd.

	Out of the 5 vowels, a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y, the letter a is the only letter in the word.

questions.text: Now eliminate the letter that comes after the letter you just took out, in the alphabet.
questions.explanation:
Lkvgd.

	After a in the alphabet comes b, so the first letter in the word is now gone.

questions.text:
Alright a little tougher now. Look at the word "LAKE", and the word "HOST". There are two letters in lake that are in our word now. Take those two letters out. Replace them with the letters that appear in the same position in the word host.

For example, if letter 3 is one of the letters, replace it with letter 3 from host.
questions.explanation:
Hsvgd.

	L and k were the letters in the same, so you would have replaced them with h and s. Look below: LAKEHOST The l and h, and k and s both have the same spot in the word.

questions.text: Right now, the five letters you have, is it a word?
questions.explanation:
No.

	There are no vowels in that line!

questions.text: Now take letter one and letter two of the word, and make them letters 3 and 4.
questions.explanation:
Vghsd.

	The h and s will leap frog the v and g to take their new positions.

questions.text: Now for the end take each letter from your answer and move it down one letter in the alphabet. So if you have an a, it would become a b, and a b would become a c. You should get the opposite of the word we started with!
questions.explanation:
White.

	V becomes W, G becomes H, H becomes I, S becomes T, and D becomes E, forming the word WHITE.
